com.iota.iri.service.transactionpruning.jobs

Class AbstractTransactionPrunerJob

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.iota.iri.service.transactionpruning.jobs.AbstractTransactionPrunerJob
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TransactionPrunerJob
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MilestonePrunerJob, UnconfirmedSubtanglePrunerJob

    public abstract class AbstractTransactionPrunerJob
extends java.lang.Object
implements TransactionPrunerJob
    Implements the most basic functionality that is shared by the different kinds of jobs.

      • AbstractTransactionPrunerJob

    • Method Detail

      • setTransactionPruner

        public void setTransactionPruner(TransactionPruner transactionPruner)
        Allows to set the TransactionPruner that this job belongs to (optional). It simply stores the passed in instance, so the job can for example persist the state, once it has finished processing a sub-task. We do not pass this parameter in via the constructor of the job, so we can also test jobs standalone outside the scope of a TransactionPruner. It gets automatically called and set when we add a job to a TransactionPruner.
        Specified by:
        setTransactionPruner in interface TransactionPrunerJob
        Parameters:
        transactionPruner - manager of the job that schedules it execution

      • getTransactionPruner

        public TransactionPruner getTransactionPruner()
        This method returns the stored TransactionPruner instance.
        Specified by:
        getTransactionPruner in interface TransactionPrunerJob
        Returns:
        manager of the job that schedules it execution

      • setTangle

        public void setTangle(Tangle tangle)
        Allows to set the Tangle object that this job should work on. We do not pass this parameter in via the constructor of the job because the container, that the job get's added to (the TransactionPruner already has knowledge about the Tangle instance we are working on and can automatically set the reference upon addition of the job. This way we reduce the amount of code that has to be written when creating a job and at the same time ensure that all jobs are automatically working on the same correct Tangle instance, while still keeping full control over the property in tests (where we might want to test a job outside the scope of a TransactionPruner).
        Specified by:
        setTangle in interface TransactionPrunerJob
        Parameters:
        tangle - Tangle object which acts as a database interface

      • getTangle

        public Tangle getTangle()
        This method returns the stored Tangle instance.
        Specified by:
        getTangle in interface TransactionPrunerJob
        Returns:
        Tangle object which acts as a database interface

      • setTipsViewModel

        public void setTipsViewModel(TipsViewModel tipsViewModel)
        Allows to set the TipsViewModel object that this job uses to remove pruned transactions from this cached instance. We do not pass this parameter in via the constructor of the job because the container, that the job get's added to (the TransactionPruner already has knowledge about the TipsViewModel instance we are working on and can automatically set the reference upon addition of the job. This way we reduce the amount of code that has to be written when creating a job and at the same time ensure that all jobs are automatically working on the same correct TipsViewModel instance, while still keeping full control over the property in tests (where we might want to test a job outside the scope of a TransactionPruner).
        Specified by:
        setTipsViewModel in interface TransactionPrunerJob
        Parameters:
        tipsViewModel - manager for the tips (required for removing pruned transactions from this manager)

      • getTipsViewModel

        public TipsViewModel getTipsViewModel()
        This method returns the previously set TipsViewModel instance.
        Specified by:
        getTipsViewModel in interface TransactionPrunerJob
        Returns:
        manager for the tips (required for removing pruned transactions from this manager)

      • setSnapshot

        public void setSnapshot(Snapshot snapshot)
        Allows to set the Snapshot that the node is using as a starting point for the state of the ledger. It can be used to retrieve important information about the range of transactions that are relevant for our node.
        Specified by:
        setSnapshot in interface TransactionPrunerJob
        Parameters:
        snapshot - last local or global snapshot that acts as a starting point for the state of ledger

      • getSnapshot

        public Snapshot getSnapshot()
        This method returns the previously set Snapshot instance.
        Specified by:
        getSnapshot in interface TransactionPrunerJob
        Returns:
        last local or global snapshot that acts as a starting point for the state of ledger

      • process

        public abstract void process()
                      throws TransactionPruningException
        This method processes the cleanup job and performs the actual pruning.
        Specified by:
        process in interface TransactionPrunerJob
        Throws:
        TransactionPruningException - if something goes wrong while processing the job

      • serialize

        public abstract java.lang.String serialize()
        This method is used to serialize the job before it gets persisted by the TransactionPruner.
        Specified by:
        serialize in interface TransactionPrunerJob
        Returns:
        string representing a serialized version of this job
